subject: Re: Database query results testing
msgSnippet: ... Michael, it probably depends on what you are using your queries for.  A while ago I had to implement a slow event queue via a database table.  I overloaded
messageBody:
Michael LÃ©pine wrote:
>I am fairly new to JUnit and am leading its integration at work. The one
>question I get a lot is, "How do we test the results of a database query?"

Michael, it probably depends on what you are using your queries for. A
while ago I
had to implement a slow event queue via a database table. I overloaded the
setup function
to insert standard stuff into the database, then tested my query
with assertEqusls, overload tearDown to take my test records out again.
So all my time/date sensitive stuff was tested as at some standard reference
date
- maybe I should have had a range of dates.


Cheers,


Simon
